title: Malaysian PM discusses Trump, Thailand-Cambodia dispute and war in Gaza in ABC interview | ABC NEWS
description: ABC’s Global Affairs Editor Laura Tingle has interviewed Malaysia’s Prime Minister as he wraps his time as ASEAN chair. Anwar Ibrahim discusses Donald Trump, finding a balance between the US and China as well as regional conflicts and the war in Gaza. title: Eight Queensland schools teach students about wrong Ceasar for year 12 exam | ABC NEWS
description: At least eight Queensland high schools have apologised for mixing up the ancient history curriculum and teaching their students about the wrong Ceasar for a year 12 exam.  The prestigious Brisbane State High School warned students they had been taught about Augustus Ceasar rather than Julius Ceasar just days before the test.  The assessment authority said students could be given special consideration, while Queensland Education Minister John-Paul Langbroek launched an investigation into the blunder. title: Albanese wraps up ASEAN visit, heads to South Korea for APEC | ABC NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has concluded his visit to Malaysia for the ASEAN summit. The Australian leader met and held a joint press conference with Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim to discuss escalating tensions and risks of confrontation in the South China Sea, after Chinese fighter jets released flares near an Australian surveillance plane. Mr Albanese is heading to South Korea for the APEC summit, where US  President Donald Trump and Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping are expected to meet on the sidelines to hash out a trade deal. title: What we know so far about Hurricane Melissa's path and strength | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa has crossed the Jamaican coast as a dangerous category five system, making it the Caribbean nation's strongest-ever storm. ABC meteorologist Nate Byrne tracks the system as it made landfall in Jamaica and now makes its way towards Cuba. title: Female Aboriginal prisoner dies in custody in Tasmania | ABC NEWS
description: An Aboriginal woman remanded in custody in Hobart died after a "serious medical episode", the Tasmania Prison Service says.  The Tasmanian Aboriginal Legal Service believes it is the first Aboriginal death in custody in Tasmania since the 1990s as Madeleine Rojahn reports. title: Teachers, other public workers begin strikes in Tasmania | ABC NEWS
description: Teachers, health workers, firefighters and other public sector employees have rallied in Tasmania's north-west as they call for better pay and conditions.  The Tasmanian government is standing by its offer of a 3 per cent pay rise, describing it as "fair and affordable". title: City of Sydney limits busking in the CBD | ABC NEWS
description: The City of Sydney is introducing laws to limit buskers from performing in the CBD. Under the changes, no busking is permitted on George Street between Circular Quay and Haymarket except for six spots, limited to an hour per busker per day on a first-in basis. title: Why you're unlikely to see an interest rate cut for the rest of the year | ABC NEWS
description: Inflation has surged in the September quarter, with consumer prices rising at an annual pace of 3.2 per cent, up from 2.1 per cent in the June quarter. It all but rules out an interest rate cut when the RBA next meets, because inflation is hotter than expected. Finance presenter Alicia Barry speaks to the lead economist with Oxford Economics Ben Udy about the result and the expectations ahead. title: Convicted rapist denied visa for volleyball competition | ABC NEWS
description: Convicted Dutch child rapist Steven van de Velde has been denied a visa to Australia to compete in the Beach Volleyball World Championships. Van de Velde was sentenced to four years in prison in 2016 after admitting to three counts of rape against a child who he had met on Facebook, with the incident taking place in August 2014. He was released after serving 12 months of his sentence and resumed his volleyball career in 2018.
